comments:
It seems that there is some faulty regular expression handeling of the CVS
commit message from the server.

This has been happening since M9, but I hadn't found the log until now.

No error is overtly displayed, but after I type in my own commit message, and
hit ok, nothing happens as this exception is thrown and logged.  I am unable to
commit to my repository.

-JJ

Yes, I see how this could happen. String#replaceAll is speced to accept a 
regular expression. The commit template of your server must have something in 
it that is interpreted as a regular expression. This is an easy fix. I will 
see if we can get approval for 3.0.

It turns out that the replaceAll is speced to throw a runtime exception 
instead of a regular exception so the community memeber who cntributed the 
code didn't catch it and continue. We should also consider using startsWith 
and endsWith instead of replaceAll. These are both easy safe fixes.

I have a patch ready which uses startsWith and endsWith to strip unmodified 
template contents. Now all I need is 2 component leads to approve the fix. (DJ 
and JM, will you both approve this for inclusion in RC3?).
